business.headline: Sensex closes 694 points lower, Nifty below 25,000; Asian Paints down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex closed 694 points lower at 81.306.85 points, while the NSE Nifty50 declined by 213.65 points to end at 24,870.10.

This investor cut his Rs 10 lakh tax bill to 0. Here's howMany taxpayers assume that once the financial year ends, their chance to save tax is gone.and Ramesh was no exception. But instead of rushing, he used a little-known route that brought his tax bill down to nothing.

Dalal Street gears up for busy week with 5 market debuts, 2 IPOs in pipelineMangal Electrical Industries is set to debut on August 28 after finalising its allotment on August 25. Patel Retail, Vikram Solar, Gem Aromatics, and Shreeji Shipping Global will all list on August 26.

Wealthy Asian families bet big on crypto: ReportThe growing interest comes as Bitcoin recently hit an all-time high of over $124,000. New rules, such as Hong Kong's stablecoin legislation and the United States' GENIUS Act, have further boosted confidence in the sector.

Real-money gaming ban rocks advertising, sports sponsorships: What's at stake?The rise of money-based platforms created billions in advertising spend, now facing a sudden halt. This article examines how the ban on real-money gaming is reshaping India's advertising, sports sponsorships, and emerging e-sports opportunities.

Credit score confusion: Is CIBIL transparent enough in deciding your financial fate?The credit score by CIBIL can decide whether someone gets a car loan, a home loan, or even a credit card. Yet, very few actually know how CIBIL works or who controls it.

ITR filing 2024–25: Comparing deductions under old and new tax regimeFiling your Income Tax Return for FY 2024–25? Before you decide on old or new tax regime, it's important to know how deductions differ. The right choice could help reduce your taxable income and overall tax burden.

Why middle class feels stuck between taxes and EMIs, explains CAThe burden is not just about taxes. Price hikes on fuel, food, education, and healthcare hit the middle class the hardest. Unlike the rich, they cannot hedge against inflation with high-value assets. Unlike the poor, they don't receive government relief.
Sensex down 600 points: Why is stock market falling today?At closing bell, indices opened marginally lower but kept sliding as the day went on. Sensex and Nifty declined over half a percent.

Will life, health insurance premiums become cheaper with zero GST proposal?Will zero GST on life and health insurance truly make premiums cheaper or will input credit losses and policy design dilute the benefits for most customers? Read to know what experts have to say.
Sensex down 350 points, Nifty below 25,000; Wipro, HCLTech down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 380.59 points to 81,620.12, while the NSE Nifty50 declined 127.95 points to 24,956.25 as of 9:30 am.

Dream11, MPL suspend money-based games after Online Gaming Bill clears ParliamentReal-money gaming faces a knockout blow as Dream11, MPL, and Zupee halt money-based online games. Dream11 is also likely to follow suit after sweeping ban.

Less than 40% ITRs processed as government pushes deadline to September 15The Finance Ministry has pushed the ITR deadline to 15 September citing extensive changes in forms and utilities. But three months in, processing is still crawling at under 40%.

Sensex, Nifty gain for 6th straight session on GST reforms optimismThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 142.87 points to 82,000.71 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 33.20 points to settle at 25,083.75.

Key panel okays scrapping of 12%, 28% GST slabs; 90% goods may get cheaperIn a key meeting held on Thursday, the panel of state ministers accepted the Centre's plan to reduce the four-rate system to two main slabs of 5% and 18%.

How can retirees stay safe from risky 'too good to be true' schemes?Many retirees fall prey to schemes that seem too good to be true, chasing high returns without understanding the risks. Protecting your savings requires caution, awareness, and smart investment choices.

Why zero GST on insurance premiums doesn't mean cheaper policies for youOn the surface, removing GST on insurance premiums seems like a big relief, but experts caution that the outcome may not be what many are expecting.

EPFO withdrawal, pension or transfer: How to choose the right PF formEPFO members often get confused about which form to fill for withdrawals, transfers, or pension claims. Using the right form not only saves time but also avoids delays or rejection of your application.

CA explains why 80% of emergency funds don't work when neededMost people believe they are financially prepared for tough times, but when a real crisis hits, their so-called emergency funds often fall short. A chartered accountant explains why this happens and how to fix it.

Online Gaming Bill 2025: What are the different penalties in it?The Bill, which was passed in the Lok Sabha soon after it was introduced, focusses on reducing risks linked to addiction, money laundering, and misleading advertising.

No GST on life, health insurance premiums soon? Here's what it means for youA proposal has been made to exempt premiums for life and health insurance from Goods and Services Tax (GST), a move that could bring down costs and boost insurance penetration.
Sensex opens 150 points higher, Nifty above 25,000; RIL gains 1%The S&P BSE Sensex added 122.01 points to 81,979.85, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 20.45 points to 25,071.00 as of 9:23 am.

4 IPOs to close for bidding today: Which one will give you best listing gains?All four IPOs opened for subscription on August 19 and will complete allotment on August 22. The listing of these companies is scheduled for August 26 on the BSE and NSE.

Now you can buy land via a mobile app in minutes. Here's howThe initiative is intended to make land purchases easier, quicker and more transparent by using a platform that millions already rely on for daily shopping.

Will next-gen GST make homes more affordable?With the government considering a simpler two-slab GST structure, many are asking a key question: Will the new system finally make home buying more affordable?

Rapido fined Rs 10 lakh over false ads, regulator orders refunds to consumersThe penalty follows complaints that Rapido's ads such as "Guaranteed Auto" and "Auto in 5 min or get Rs 50" misled customers by creating the impression of guaranteed services.
Sensex ends 213 points higher, Nifty above 25,000; Infosys up 4%The S&P BSE Sensex gained 213.45 points to close at 81,857.84, while the NSE Nifty50 added 69.90 points to end at 25,050.55.

CA explains the risks behind 'No EMI till possession' schemesMany homebuyers are lured by "No EMI Till Possession" schemes, but a chartered accountant warns that these offers can carry hidden financial risks that may leave buyers paying for a property they never receive.

Indian-state run refiners resume Russian oil purchase amid tariff threats: ReportThe resumption of Russian oil imports by Indian state refiners could reduce supplies for top buyer China, which had stepped up purchases during their absence.

Labubu mania is back as Pop Mart shares rise by 11%, CEO predicts record salesPop Mart reported a 204% rise in revenue to 13.88 billion yuan for the first half of 2025, beating the average analyst estimate of 13.76 billion yuan. Net income jumped 397% to 4.57 billion yuan, highlighting the company's rapid growth.

Online gaming bill: Nazara Technologies and Delta Corp shares take a hitThe bill, which proposes strict rules for money-based online games and makes online betting a punishable offence, is expected to be tabled in the Lok Sabha later today.

Shifted to new tax regime? Here are 5 investments you shouldn't dropAlthough the new regime comes with lower tax rates and no exemptions, several traditional investment products continue to play a vital role in securing your finances and growing long-term wealth.

US targets Indian refiners, says richest families made excess profitsThe criticism from US is focused on India's private refiners, particularly Reliance Industries and Nayara Energy, which together account for a large share of refined fuel exports to Europe.

Ola Electric shares jump 13%, up over 20% in two sessions. Should you buy?On Tuesday, the stock climbed almost sharply after founder and chairman Bhavish Aggarwal outlined an aggressive strategy to reclaim market share and improve profitability in India's competitive EV segment.

Sensex, Nifty open lower as financial stocks offset IT gains in early tradeThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 125.67 points to 81,518.72, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 34.50 points to 24,946.15 as of 9:33 am.

Game over for money-based online gaming? Industry in shock over proposed banIf passed in Parliament, the bill will outlaw all money-based online games (irrespective of whether they involve skill or chance), ban advertisements promoting such platforms, and bar banks and financial institutions from processing related transactions.

Death knell for industry: Gaming body writes to Amit Shah on money-based gaming banIn its communication, the All India Gaming Federation stressed the need for "progressive regulation" rather than outright prohibition, highlighting the potential fallout for millions of players and the broader industry.

Centre to ban all money-based gaming transactions under new bill: SourcesUnder the proposed Regulation & Promotion of Online Gaming Act, banks and financial institutions will not be allowed to process or transfer funds for real-money online games.

Sensex, Nifty close higher on GST buzz, easing global tensionsThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 370.64 points, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 103.70 points to settle at 24,980.65. Broader markets also ended in the green, with mid- and small-cap stocks outperforming.

PM Viksit Bharat Rozgar Yojana: Who can get Rs 15,000 and other benefitsFirst-time employees under Part A can receive a one-time incentive equal to about one month's basic pay, up to Rs 15,000, paid in two instalments.

entertainment.headline: Bhagwant Mann mourns Jaswinder Bhalla's death: Chacha Chatra will live in our heartsPunjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann condoled the death of veteran actor-comedian Jaswinder Bhalla in an emotional note. The 'Carry on Jatta' actor died on August 22 at 65.

Bigg Boss 12 fame Saba Khan marries businessmen Waseem Nawab in Jodhpur. See PicsActor Saba Khan, who featured in 'Bigg Boss 12', got married to businessman Waseem Nawab in an intimate ceremony in Jodhpur. She shared a heartfelt note on social media along with her wedding pictures.

R Madhavan, wife celebrate son's 20th birthday, Rehna Hai co-star Dia sends wishesOn the occasion of their son Vedaant's birthday, actor R Madhavan's wife shared a series of throwback photos on social media. Several actors, including Dia Mirza and Ronit Roy, extended their wishes in the comment section of the post.

Sima Taparia rejects Nausheen Ali Sardar's matchmaking request over religionNausheen Ali Sardar revealed that matchmaker Sima Taparia refused to help her find a life partner due to her religion. The actor criticised Taparia's conservative views and questioned who defines the right match for her.

Jr NTR to reassess future choices after War 2's poor theatrical run | ExclusiveJr NTR is now rethinking his Bollywood journey following the underperformance of 'War 2'. The actor is now concentrating on Telugu cinema and a major pan-India project with director Prashanth Neel to strengthen his mass appeal.

Bigg Boss 19 official confirmed contestants list revealed. Find out moreBigg Boss 19 has officially commenced shooting with 17 diverse contestants including actors, singers, influencers and comedians, hosted by Salman Khan. The season promises exciting twists with special entries like Mike Tyson and a mix of familiar and fresh faces from India and abroad.

Did Krushna Abhishek and Kiku Sharda fight on Kapil Show? Viral video suggests soA viral video of comedians Krushna Abhishek and Kiku Sharda getting into a heated argument has shocked fans. Neither of the duo has issued any statemnet on the spat.

Apoorva Mukhija responds to her ex's viral song: Truth always comes outInfluencer Apoorva Mukhija has reacted to cheating allegations by her ex-boyfriend, Utsav Dahiya. She commented on a reel of an influencer, stating that the truth always comes out. Meanwhile, Dahiya alleged that attempts are being made to hack into his social media account.

Shwetha Menon leads 1st film body meeting as president, prioritises member safetyThe Association of Malayalam Movie Artistes (AMMA) held its first committee meeting post-elections in Kochi. President Shwetha Menon emphasised member safety and announced new committees.

Salman Khan fans say AR Murugadoss blames everyone but himself for Sikandar failureDirector AR Murugadoss recently opened up on facing difficulties during 'Sikandar' shoot with actor Salman Khan due to late call times. Fans criticised the director for blaming the actor for the film's failure, sparking a heated debate.

Swara Bhaskar updates X bio after her Dimple Yadav confession sparks buzzActor Swara Bhasker modified her X bio to include 'girl crush advocate' on Friday. She also flaunted the update on her social media platform. This came after the actor shared her views on bisexuality and admitted to having a crush on Samajwadi Party MP Dimple Yadav.

Rajinikanth's grandson, composer Anirudh turn bouncers for Thalaivar at event. ViralRajinikanth's grandson Lingaa and nephew Anirudh Ravichander, along with other bouncers, protected and escorted him to the car. The video is now going viral on social media

Vir Das welcomes top court's modified order for sterilisation, return of stray dogs Vir Das praised the Supreme Court for balancing safety with compassion in its modified order, and urged municipalities to act swiftly on feeding areas and training support.

Ram Charan touches Chiranjeevi's feet, wishes best father on 70th birthday. WatchRam Charan touched his father Chiranjeevi's feet and fed him cake in the birthday celebration video that he shared on his Instagram page. He called Megastar the best father anyone could wish for.

KBC 17: Big B flirts with contestant, keeps her lipstick-stained handkerchiefIn the latest promo of 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 17', Amitabh Bachchan playfully interacted with a contestant. The veteran actor then took her handkerchief and kept it with him.

K-dramas have cracked the romance code and why Hollywood can't keep upK-dramas have perfected swoon-worthy romance with iconic scenes, umbrellas, rain kisses, piggybacks, and cherry blossoms. In this week's K-fix, we will discuss why their love stories hit differently.

Salman Khan begins Battle of Galwan shoot in Ladakh, director shares glimpseActor Salman Khan has started shooting for his much-anticipated film 'Battle of Galwan' in Ladakh. A day after a behind-the-scenes photo went viral, director Aapoorva Lakhia shared updates on social media.

Chiranjeevi turns 70: Pawan Kalyan to Allu Arjun, celebs wish Megastar on birthdayMegastar Chiranjeevi is celebrating his 70th birthday today, August 22. His brother Pawan Kalyan, Allu Arjun and several others conveyed their wishes to the superstar.

Alia Bhatt, Soni Razdan enjoy beach holiday with Shaheen and her boyfriend. PicsShaheen Bhatt gave fans a glimpse of her beach getaway with sister Alia Bhatt on Instagram. The two were joined by their mother, Soni Razdan.

general news.headline: Top court says Aadhaar can be used for Bihar claims, raps parties on 'inaction'The Supreme Court's remarks came after the Election Commission said none of the major political parties in Bihar filed any objections over the draft electoral rolls.

Release stray dogs after sterilisation: Supreme Court modifies its 'harsh' orderStray dogs verdict: The Supreme Court said stray dogs, which are picked up, must be released after immunisation, except those that are infected with rabies or exhibit aggressive behaviour.

Will India take China's advice on bully Trump?The Chinese envoy to India goaded New Delhi to take on US President Trump, saying "silence only emboldens the bully". While China threatened the US with reciprocal tariffs, India has taken a more nuanced diplomatic approach. Trade figures reveal why India isn't China. However, India is acting, but silently, with the belief that patience pays.

Tata EV 'in Summon Mode' knocks man down, CCTV captures fatal accidentTata Motors expressed condolences after a tragic accident in Tamil Nadu's Tiruppur district, where a man named Senthil reportedly died in a Tata Harrier EV mishap. The SUV, reportedly in Summon Mode, rolled back outside his shop, fatally striking him.

It was a tax, that too on tea from China, that led to US independenceWith eye on China, President Trump has led the US into a tariff war. However, it was the issue of tax on a Chinese export, tea, that sparked the American Revolution, which ultimately led to the independence of the US from Britain. Yes, we are referring to the Boston Tea Party of 1773 when Chinese tea was dumped into the Atlantic Ocean.

Rags to riches to rags: Mumbai man lost Rs 12 crore to online money gamingAjit Tripathi (name changed) came across an ad on social media and started investing in online games during the Covid-19 pandemic in 2021. In the next three years, he lost Rs 27 crore but could only recover Rs 15 crore.

Deposit Rs 2 lakh for stray dog welfare to appear in case: Top court to NGOsThe Supreme Court on Friday, in its modified order on stray dogs, said: "Every individual dog lover and NGO intervening in the suo moto proceedings must deposit Rs 25,000 and Rs 2 lakh respectively, with the court's registry. Failure to comply will disqualify them from further participation in the case."

The sponsorship jinx: Why brands on Team India's jersey turn to dust?Indian cricket team jersey sponsor Dream11 faced a major setback due to the Online Gaming Bill being passed in parliament. Interestingly, this makes 5th straight BCCI sponsor who has got into one or the other problem.

Serena Williams turns to GLP-1 drugs: Is it a new era in weight loss?Serena Williams revealed she uses GLP-1 medication to aid weight loss after motherhood. This highlights a shift towards combining medicine with lifestyle for obesity management.

Why did students in Bangladesh turn towards fundamentalism?How did Bangladesh's campuses come to be dominated by fundamentalist students by 2024? The situation was a stark reversal from the progressive activism of 1971. Decades of dynastic politics and the erosion of independent leadership due to a ban on campus elections were exploited by fundamentalists.

Hitting Trump where it hurts, China's soybean shift to Brazil strains US farmersAfter Russia and China rolled out the red carpet for Indian goods, another Brics nation, Brazil — which has also faced tariffs of up to 50% similar to those on India — is now replacing the US as Beijing's main soybean supplier, according to reports.

No one can give orders from jail: PM's push for 'criminal netas' bill in BiharPM Modi asserted that "no one can give orders from jail," as he targeted parties that, he claimed, treat Bihar's people merely as a vote bank while ignoring their aspirations, dignity and development.

Indians used gold coins in Harappan, Rig Vedic period, 3,000 years before believedNew research by India's top archaeologist BR Mani reveals that the Harappans and Vedic people were using gold coins, known as Nishka. The coins were used as currency, trade assets, ritual offerings and status symbols, says Mani. This discovery pushes back the timeline of Indian gold coinage by nearly three millennia, which would reshape our understanding of the subcontinent's ancient economy and culture.

Street dogs case: Who's emerged victorious after Supreme Court's verdict?In the street dog case, the Supreme Court's verdict sees elements of both sides of the stray dog arguments: strays will be sterilised and vaccinated, aggressive ones will be kept in shelters, and public feeding will be limited to designated areas. But which side really won the stray dog debate?

Will cheaper obesity drugs actually make India healthier?This is but a fact that obesity drugs are only going to get more accessible for Indians post-March 2026. But whether they make us healthier depends on how we use them. If they become another over-the-counter fad, the country risks trading one public health crisis for another.

As Modi govt tables bills to prevent 'rule from jail', why Opposition smells a ployThe Modi government calls the three bills introduced by home minister Amit Shah as anti-corruption reform while critics allege executive overreach and political misuse

Credit score confusion: Is CIBIL transparent enough in deciding your financial fate?The credit score by CIBIL can decide whether someone gets a car loan, a home loan, or even a credit card. Yet, very few actually know how CIBIL works or who controls it.

Gujarat man who sent Rs 2,000 to Rekha Gupta's attacker detained by Delhi PoliceThe man, along with four others, was picked up for interrogation by Delhi Police in Rajkot. He has now been brought to Delhi for further questioning.

Women's World Cup matches moved out of Bengaluru after stadium stampede fiascoICC Women's World Cup 2025: Five matches originally scheduled at M. Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru have been moved to DY Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai. The ICC announced the venue change on Friday, August 22, after the Karnataka state cricket body failed to secure the necessary approvals following the stampede incident during RCB's victory celebrations in June.
In a Sholay remake, who'd be Thakur and Gabbar: Sherlock Holmes finds outAt 221B, the hunt for Thakur and Gabbar begins, and the casting debate turns deadly serious.

Three out of four students choose gaming over therapyIndian students facing academic pressure mostly cope through distractions like gaming and binge-watching. Experts warn this avoidance worsens mental health and call for better counselling access and stigma reduction.

PM Modi inaugurates Asia's widest six-lane bridge in Bihar: Key featuresIndia's widest six-lane cable-stayed bridge over the Ganga is now open in Bihar, connecting North and South Bihar directly.
The Aunta-Simaria Bridge will save hours of travel time, boost trade, and mark a new era in regional development.

Congress, RJD plotting to hand rights to illegals: PM's demography mission pushIn poll-bound Bihar, PM Modi accused the Congress and RJD of plotting to "snatch away people's rights and give them to illegal immigrants" to expand their vote banks.

Days after assault, man storms Rekha Gupta's event, shouts slogans; detainedDays after an earlier assault, a man, Praveen Sharma, disrupted Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta's event with slogans against MLA Arvinder Singh Lovely and was promptly detained.

Learnt from Mohanlal, time to unlearn a few things: Film body president Shwetha MenonShwetha Menon, who has been newly appointed as the president of AMMA, said she has begun the work to provide a makeover to the association. She said "it's time to unlearn a few things."

Bhagwant Mann mourns Jaswinder Bhalla's death: Chacha Chatra will live in our heartsPunjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann condoled the death of veteran actor-comedian Jaswinder Bhalla in an emotional note. The 'Carry on Jatta' actor died on August 22 at 65.

Video: Akshay Kumar promotes gender-fluid fashion in basket pants worth Rs 82,000Akshay Kumar was clicked at the Kalina aiport today. The Bollywood star turned heads with his gender-fluid fashion. He was sporting basket pants that he teamed up with a black T-shirt. The Homme Plisse Issey Miyake pants cost Rs 82,756.

Bigg Boss 12 fame Saba Khan marries businessmen Waseem Nawab in Jodhpur. See PicsActor Saba Khan, who featured in 'Bigg Boss 12', got married to businessman Waseem Nawab in an intimate ceremony in Jodhpur. She shared a heartfelt note on social media along with her wedding pictures.

sports.headline: ISL stand-off: Supreme Court asks AIFF, organisers to find solution soonThe Supreme Court has directed AIFF and FSDL to settle the Master Rights Agreement dispute before August 28, 2025, to decide the future of ISL 2025-26.

Shuttlecock crisis in badminton has not reached alarming levels: BWFThe Badminton World Federation has acknowledged the issue of global shuttlecock shortage. However, they have denied that it has reached a critical level yet.

Live telecast selection meetings so fans know why players are dropped: Manoj TiwaryFormer cricketer Manoj Tiwary has called for BCCI to live stream selection meetings to improve transparency. This demand follows controversy over the exclusion of Shreyas Iyer and Yashasvi Jaiswal from the Asia Cup squad.

Virat and Rohit are still very fit, hope they play 2027 World Cup: Ross TaylorFormer New Zealand batter Ross Taylor has shared his thoughts on Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma playing till the ODI World Cup 2027, mentioning the various factors which could affect their decisions.

Will Shreyas Iyer to take over Rohit Sharma as ODI captain?BCCI secretary Devajit Saikia has ruled out the possibility of having Shreyas Iyer as the next India ODI captain. The board is likely grooming Shubman Gill for that position.

The ICC announced the venue change on Friday, August 22, after the Karnataka state cricket body failed to secure the necessary approvals following the stampede incident during RCB's victory celebrations in June.

R Ashwin reveals reason behind retirement: Sitting out of the team got to meRavichandran Ashwin has finally broken the silence on his sudden international retirement from all forms of cricket in December 2024. The legendary spinner has cited non-selection on away tours and family commitments as reasons behind his decision not to play further cricket for India.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
